title: Laptop Freezes and Makes a Loud Buzzing Sounds When I First Get in Game
body: One morning I woke up and my laptop wouldn't turn on so I had to reinstall windows which wiped out my applications but not my files. Once that was done I went to run League of Legends and it wouldn't work because stuff had gotten deleted from the reset so i deleted everything that i could find and I reinstalled. everything was running perfectly but right when i get in game (when we are all by the nexus closed in) the game just freezes and my laptop makes a loud buzzing sound. Ive tried reinstalling several times and ive ran tests on my computer and it says that nothing is wrong with the computer. I always freeze right after the game loads. What do I do to fix that? Please help.

replies.body: The game freeze and buzzing could be an issue caused by a recent Windows 10 update.  More specifically, the [Xbox Game Bar ](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) has been causing problems for some players.  Disabling it should get things fixed up!
Porocles solution worked for my friend and I's computers. Thank you so much.

hey derek! I had the same problem with the new Windows 10 update!

if you right click the League application and select "Test Compatibility" it will run a diagnostic and fix the problem for you!

:)
